The '''Official Minecraft Server List''' is a website launched by [[Mojang Studios]] and [https://gamersafer.com/ GamerSafer], that allows players to find [[server]]s to play in for {{els|je|be}}. It was launched in November 2023,<ref name=mcnet/><ref name=gamersafer/> but was in development for about 1 year.<ref group=note>This can be checked by doing {{w|WHOIS}} query on "findmcserver.com" domain; it was registered on November 8, 2022. ([https://web.archive.org/web/20250614080540/https://www.whois.com/whois/findmcserver.com archive])</ref>

== Overview ==
The website features a list of servers for the player to choose from, where each server contains its own categories based on game modes, features, server type, and other factors, while displaying the [[#Badges|available badges]] on the server box.

According to [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/the-official-minecraft-server-list-live Minecraft.net's article], all listed servers must comply with the [https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/usage-guidelines Minecraft Usage Guidelines] (MUG), and they must provide official contact information and state the purpose of the server.

Any server owner with a significant amount of players may be able to apply to the website, through the [https://findmcserver.com/add-your-server Add Your Server page] and following the listed Basic Eligibility Requirements.

== Badges ==
All servers listed on the Official Minecraft Server List have a badge, which [https://findmcserver.com/badges-explained according to the Badges page] are awarded for servers who showcase their work and commitment to safe and enjoyable experiences.
